item.title: #CottonViz Data Visualisation Challenge
item.description: In June, the #CottonViz data visualisation challenge was run by the History of Statistics & Young Statisticians sections of the Royal Statistical Society (RSS). The challenge aimed to celebrate the work of Mary Eleanor Spear (1897 â€“1986), credited with popularising the range-bar charts. Reimagining Mary Eleanor Spear's visualisation of US cotton supply for the #CotttonViz competition with @HistoryofStats and @statsyss. First time using the {ggpattern} package (great for colourblind-friendly visualisations).#DataVisualization #DataViz #RStats pic.

item.title: Du Bois Challenge
item.description: The Du Bois Challenge is part of a celebration of the data visualization legacy of W.E.B Du Bois which attempts to recreate the visualizations from the 1900 Paris Exposition using modern tools. Check out the challenge here. Note that the text in the visualisations is taken from the original charts and uses antiquated terms to refer to populations of colour. My own attempts at the #DuBoisChallenge are here: https://t.
